speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Kids!

line: MOM! MOM!

line: Kevin!

line: MOM! MOM! MOM! MOM! MOM! MOM! MOM! Ruby's gone.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder's latest 3-0-2, requesting assignment and travel expenses for the both of you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sioux City, Iowa. That's the first I've heard of it.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: It came up through channels, from Mulder's Asat, to the district G-14 and onto my desk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: In essence, Mulder is petitioning the bureau to assign a case number to a tabloid headline.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He must have more evidence than..

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Not according to his 3-0-2, he doesn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I admit, that is strange. Even for Mulder.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Perhaps, it has something to do with this, take a look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: An X-File. Name Samantha T. Mulder Address 2790 Vine Street City Chilmarc, Mass. Place of Birth Chilmarc, Mass. Date of Birth January 22, 1964 Nationality American

speaker: REMARKS
line: Name and address of nearest relative notified in case of emergency. Fox Mulder c/o F.B.I. Washington Bureau

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Has he shared any of this with you? There's no need to protect him, he's the agent of record, he initiated the file himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was his sister, she disappeared twenty-one years ago, he was, twelve and she was eight. He claims that he was in the room when it happened. He recalls a, bright light outside the window and er, and a presence in the room.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: In your opinion, has Agent Mulder's personal agenda clouded his professional judgement?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In my opinion, no.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: But you can see, how it might appear that way. As you know, Agent Mulder's pre-occupation with fringe matters has been a big source of friction in the bureau, this is another case in point. I'm gonna disallow the 3- 0-2.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With respect sir, at least let me talk with him, and make a recommendation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It just doesn't seem, substantial enough to warrant an investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ok Scully, so we disagree, it's not the first time and it won't be the last.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, at least if we had a legitimate source, we could..

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the essence of science, you ask an impertinent question and you're on your way to a pertinent answer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But what makes this case anymore credible, than......the hundred year old mother with the lizard baby?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because, the lizard baby, wasn't born anywhere near Lake Okobogee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oko-what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Bogee. Okobogee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that supposed to mean something to me?

speaker: MULDER
line: If you know anything about trout fishing, or UFO hotspots.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Define hotspot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Four sightings in 1967, August, including one by a national weather service plane. This is a light blasted, digitally enhanced enlargement.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The pilot took that photograph?

speaker: MULDER
line: Try a girl scout with an instamatic. Four of the nine girls in the troupe claim to have seen something, five if you include the den mother. The Air Force said it was a weather balloon caught in a wind sheer. But there wasn't a weather balloon launched that day within seven hundred miles. Now read me the names of those girl scouts from 1967.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lisa Tyrell, Bonnie Winston, Dorreen McAllister, Darlene Mor...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the same Darlene Morris.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Miss Darlene Morris? I'm Agent Scully and this is Agent Fox Mulder, we talked with you on the phone last night.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Er, please come in. Well I, knew that if I screamed, loud and long enough that, someone would listen. But I never expected the FBI. Er, this is Kevin. Kevin, say "hi". Would you like some coffee?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmmm.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Somedays I can't even, get myself up out of bed. And, Kevin has been acting so strange, er, I don't know what to do anymore. I, I just, want her back again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Miss Morris, during the divorce, was there a custody battle?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Charles had nothing to do with this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How can you be so sure?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Because I know what happened. It's just like it was before.

speaker: MULDER
line: Summer of 1967, the girl scout troupe?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: How did you know about that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your name's on record at the center for UFO studies in Evanston, Illinois.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Really?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yea, pilot for the national weather service made a similar sighting over the same area on the same day.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: They took her didn't they Mr. Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: You, you said that erm, Kevin was there, the night it happened.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: He didn't see anything, he was asleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think I might talk to him anyway? Thanks.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: You know, I've told this story so many times now, oh to the newspapers and the police. And everytime I tell it, people get this, look in their eye, just like the look that you've got right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey buddy! Mind if I sit down? Thanks. Your mom tells me you've been having nightmares.

speaker: KEVIN MORRIS
line: I guess so.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wanna tell me about `em?

speaker: KEVIN MORRIS
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alright. Whatta you doing? Are you making something? Can I take a look at it? Thanks.

line: It's coming from there.

line: The TV?

line: AUG 26

speaker: FROM
line: FOX MULDER

speaker: REPORTING TO
line: CRYPTOGRAPHY SECTION, F.B.I. WASH. D.C.

line: I don't know what it is, maybe a binary sequence of some kind. Could be anything, could be nothing. I know you're busy, look erm, I know a friend who knows a friend who knows a friend who-oo can get you tickets to a Redskins game. You got it. Alright, you know where to find me? Thanks Danny.

speaker: SIOUX CITY SHERIFF
line: So, as I was telling your partner, we found no evidence of kidnap, no phone call, no ransom note, and since we didn't turn up a body....

speaker: MULDER
line: You assume she ran away.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Well, it wouldn't be the first time Ruby Morris ran away from home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, how do you explain what her mother saw?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Well I think that Darlene has a very active imagination. I've been listening to those stories since the first grade.

speaker: MULDER
line: So basically you ignored her statement.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: I included it in my report.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you didn't bother to check it out.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: We went out to the camp sight, we didn't find anything. Let me tell you something, Darlene's little girl was no prom queen. I can't count the number of times I pulled her out of parked cars, or found her puking her guts out by the side of the road, it was just a matter of time before...

speaker: MULDER
line: Before what?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Before something bad happened to her and if Darlene needs to make up crazy stories to get past that, fine. But don't tell me to treat it as the truth, I not gonna waste my time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just think it's a good idea not to antagonise local law enforcement.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who me? I'm Mr. Congeniality.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You never know, we might need his help one of these days.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll send him a bunt cake.

line: You're looking for Ruby, right?

line: That's right. Who are you?

line: Doesn't matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you a friend of Ruby's?

line: Ruby didn't have friends, she just had people she liked to hang with.

line: Guess we had some times.

line: Like the night she disappeared?

line: It was Greg, she was supposed to see him that night.

line: Her boyfriend, Greg Randall. Supposed to meet up at the lake. Had stuff to talk about.

line: What kind of stuff?

line: Greg got Ruby pregnant. I don't know, whatever, she got herself pregnant.

line: Do you know what they were planning to do about it?

speaker: TESSA
line: Gonna leave town, least that's what Ruby told me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know Greg from School?

line: Greg, school, I don't think so. All he ever did since we met him was pour beer, The Pennyslvania Pub.

line: `scuse me. Do you know where we could find Greg Randall?

line: Who's asking? What kind of trouble's he got himself into now?

line: Flying saucer. You don't really believe in that stuff do ya?

line: I take it you don't.

line: No, I think it's all just a bunch of crazy people howling at the moon.

line: You should ride with us sometime, you might see somethings that'll change your mind. Get a killer sunburn in the middle of the night.

line: Yeah.

line: Where did you get the document?

line: Well, if you explain to me what you're talking about, maybe I can help you out. This is a document? Just looks like a bunch of ones and zeroes to me.

line: Tell me where you got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me what it is.

line: Keep playing games Mulder, I'll haul your ass up in front of the D6. You can explain to them, what you're doing obstructing justice.

line: It's your call Holtzman. So unless they tell me otherwise, I'm not accountable to anybody outside my sub-committee. I don't care if it's the NSA or the Vatican Police.

line: You're kidding.

line: Just a fragment but highly classified, we need to know where it came from.

line: Well sure, I'll let you know as soon as I find out.

line: That's it Mulder, you just bought yourself a oneway back to Washington.

line: Watch your step, ma'm.

line: We scanned all seventy-seven pages through the mainframe in Washington.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And none of the information is actionable?

speaker: LEZA ATSUMI
line: Other than the satellite transmission, nothing can be construed, in anyway, as a national security risk. As far as I know, the boy's being released this afternoon.

line: So it's just a random set of ones and zeroes.

line: On the contrary, there was nothing random about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: LEZA ATSUMI
line: All information can be rendered digitally, in a series of ones and zeroes. When we downloaded the of a picture comes up) Da Vinci's Vitruvian Man. A DNA double helix. Oh, there's lots more.

line: But they're just fragments, a few notes here, a few notes there. A line from the Koran, a Shakespearean sonnet...

line: Almost like someone's switching channels, huh.

line: Mrs. Morris.

line: I have nothing to say to you.

line: Mrs. Morris, please give me a minute to explain.

line: Would you please just wait right over there for momma, I'll be right there. I thought you were both supposed to be here, to help us.

line: This has been a terrible mistake. And I assure you that the government will pay for all repairs and damages.

line: You stay away from me, and you stay away from my child. C'mon honey, it's ok, let's, let's go now.

line: I thought we were headed back into town. Where are we going?

line: The key to what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Finding Ruby. Just think about it for a minute, this is a boy who is receiving all kinds of digitised data from a television screen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Atsumi said it was a statistical aberration.

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ok, I admit it, it's not much of an explanation but it..

line: I think that Kevin is a conduit, of some kind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A conduit.

speaker: MULDER
line: A link, or a connection, to whoever, or whatever, took Ruby that night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But how?

speaker: MULDER
line: If there was an abduction, it's likely that Kevin was touched in some way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder I know what you're thinking. I know why this is so important to you. I know. But there is no evidence indicating an abduction.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's why we're going to Lake Okobogee.

speaker: MULDER
line: According to the police photos, Ruby and Kevin were sleeping right here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just a stones throw from the forest wall.

speaker: MULDER
line: Meaning what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Meaning anybody could've come out of the forest to grab her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you noticed the tree line? Evidence of extreme heat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or an electrical storm. Besides which, there's nothing to connect it to the night of Ruby's disappearance.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's true. Do you think a lightning strike could've caused this? Do you have any idea at what temperature sand solidifies into glass? Twenty-five hundred degrees fahrenheit. Something was out here Scully, something hot enough to turn sand into glass, that, singed those trees and to blister the roof of that camper.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look. What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a grave. Shallow, by the smell of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder what are you doing? Mulder, you are disturbing a crime scene. Stop.

line: What if it's her? I need to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You ok Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Fine.

speaker: CORONER
line: Looks like a male caucasian.

line: Sir.

line: Victim's name was Greg Randall.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ruby's boyfriend.

line: Ruby had alot of boyfriends.

line: Before you put that away, can I take a look at it?

line: Go right ahead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at that, it's her, the girl from the library.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We didn't get her name but she claimed Greg and Ruby had run off together.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Well, Doc Fowler's a buddy o mine, delivered both my kids. I could find out who had that appointment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have a seat Tessa. We know that you lied to us the other day. We know that you had the appointment with Doctor Fowler on August 7th. We know that you're the one that's pregnant, not Ruby.

speaker: TESSA
line: Aah, don't know nothing do ye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We can prove it Tessa, and we can prove that Greg, was the father.

speaker: TESSA
line: So what if he was the father.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is very serious. Do you understand how serious this is? Now you've waived the right to an attorney, so if you lie to us here today, you could be charged with perjury.

speaker: TESSA
line: Promised me we'd be in L.A. by Christmas. He had a friend there, I'd never seen the ocean.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said that he and Ruby were seeing each other. You said that they were planning to meet at the lake, is that true?

speaker: TESSA
line: Look it, I was nowhere near the lake that night, ok.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure you were Tessa. You knew they were meeting, so you sat there and you waited for them. You were angry and you were jealous.

speaker: TESSA
line: I wasn't.

speaker: MULDER
line: You sat there and you waited and when they showed, you killed him first, isn't that how it went?

speaker: TESSA
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: You snuck up from behind him and you shot him in the back, BAAMMM. And then you killed Ruby, BAAMMM. What was she doing right before she died Tessa? Was she pleading for her life? Was she running away?

speaker: TESSA
line: I didn't kill her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's she buried Tessa?

speaker: TESSA
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't know where you buried her Tessa.

speaker: TESSA
line: I didn't kill her.

speaker: MULDER
line: You didn't?

speaker: TESSA
line: SHE WASN'T EVEN THERE THAT NIGHT!

speaker: MULDER
line: Well how would you know that Tessa, if you weren't there yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder you're not seeing the whole picture here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which is that all likelihood, Ruby is dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that your conclusion or the conclusion of the Sioux City Sheriff's Department?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're searching the national park and a rescue dive team is coming in from Des Moines to drag the lake.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're wasting their time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you really think Tessa Seers is telling the truth?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not, what if Ruby never did show up that night?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She lied to us in the library, she lied to us about her pregnancy, what makes you think she wouldn't lie to us about killing Ruby?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because something was out there in those woods.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have a suspect in custody, we have a confession to one murder, and we have a statement which speaks to the intent to commit another. It's over Mulder. It's time to go home and turn this over to local law enforcement.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't do that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: To talk to the boy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Darlene won't even let you in the door.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I've gotta see him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They don't wanna have anything to do with you...us. Mulder stop. Stop running after your sister. This won't bring her back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come with me or don't come with me but until they find a body, I'm not giving up on that girl.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello? Mrs. Morris?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Kevin? Mulder. What does it mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm gonna check upstairs. Oh my god.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just come up here. Look, it's her, it's Ruby.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is a longshot Mulder, they could be anywhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know when I was a kid, I had this ritual. I closed my eyes before I walked into my room, cause I thought that one day when I opened them my sister would be there. Just lying in bed, like nothing ever happened. You know I'm still walking into that room, everyday of my life. Scully. DARLENE!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, there's a trail ahead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you ok?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: It's here, I saw it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Kevin?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: I couldn't keep up with him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Go ahead.

speaker: MULDER
line: KEVIN! You ok?

speaker: KEVIN MORRIS
line: She's back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kevin I'm sorry but, I don't...

speaker: KEVIN MORRIS
line: She's here I know it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kevin I don't think she is. I know how much you want it to be her, I did too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: MULDER!

speaker: MULDER
line: SCULLY!

speaker: KEVIN MORRIS
line: RUBY!

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's unconcious but she's still alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll get help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nurse says she been awake for almost an hour.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any ideas what caused the coma?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Eerrr, there's no sign of head trauma, no narcotic traces or electralight abnormalities, but her white blood cell count was skyhigh.

speaker: MULDER
line: By any chance was there attendant reduction in the lymphocyte population or a release of gluco-cordacoids?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Errmmm, actually both, how did you know that?

speaker: MULDER
line: They're symptoms of prolonged weightlessness. Shuttle astronauts have reported similar imbalances.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. Hi Ruby.

speaker: RUBY MORRIS
line: Who are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ooh, we're with the FBI, I'm Special Agent Dana Scully and this is Fox Mulder.

speaker: RUBY MORRIS
line: My mom said you might be coming by.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How are you feeling?

speaker: RUBY MORRIS
line: Fine I guess.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where were you Ruby? Can you tell us?

speaker: KEVIN MORRIS
line: It's ok Ruby, he knows.

speaker: RUBY MORRIS
line: Ah, I'm not supposed to tell. They told me not to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who told you? Ruby, who told you?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Sweetheart, you don't have to say anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're right, we should wait until Ruby gets a little stronger.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Can we speak outside for a moment. I think that it's best that we put all of this, behind us. I mean, hasn't Ruby been through enough already?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know how dis-oriented she must seem right now, but in a couple of weeks, maybe even a few days, we could..

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: I don't want her talking to you, or anyone.

speaker: MULDER
line: She should be encouraged to tell her story, not to keep it inside, it's important that you let her.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Important to who? I have my daughter back, I don't want anymore trouble. Besides she can hardly remember anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: But she will remember one day, one way or another, even if it's only in dreams. And when she does, she's gonna wanna talk about it, she's gonna need to talk about it.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: Like I did? Listen to me, all of my life I have been ridiculed, for speaking my mind.

speaker: MULDER
line: But it was the truth Darlene.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: The truth has caused me nothing but heartache, I don't want the same thing for her.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't have to be that way for Ruby.

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: As far as I'm concerned, she spent the last month on the back of a Harley Davidson.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what you're gonna tell Kevin?

speaker: DARLENE MORRIS
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: But your eyes are open?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, they're open but it's like, nothing's happening.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: Try turning your head.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: Why not?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. I can't move, so I don't... I just lie there in bed.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: Can you see your sister?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but I can hear her.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: What is she saying?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's calling out my name, over and over again. She's crying out for help but I can't help her. I can't move.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: Are you scared?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know I should be but I'm not.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: Do you know why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because of the voice.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: The voice?

speaker: MULDER
line: The voice in my head.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: What's it telling you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not to be afraid. It's telling me no harm will come to her, and that one day she'll return.

speaker: DR. HEITZ WERBER
line: Do you believe the voice?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to believe.
